file_content.text: We'll be safe here, for now.
People of Makeb--your heroes return!
Watch out. Uncle Shalim's running for president of whatever planet we all move to.
This heroic Jedi led us to victory against the Hutt treachery. Now we have freedom and an ark that will deliver us to safety!
This distinguished Jedi has protected our oppressed people and bestowed hope on Makeb. The Regulators are defeated--the ark is secured!
The Republic sent none less than the elite Havoc Squad to save us. They drove back the Regulators and secured the ark!
Makeb's most mysterious ally is now our savior. Thank you, Captain, for driving back the Regulators and securing the ark!
These champions of Makeb bring us not only hope of freedom from Hutt oppression, but deliverance in the form of the ark!
I know you're all scared. You have good reason--but the time for fear is ending.
Hope will free us all!
The Hutts only control you when you are broken and despairing. Look to your neighbors, your friends, your loved ones for strength.
Through compassion and hope, you will survive this. May the Force be with you.
Makeb is a paradise. You built this planet, with blood and sweat, patience and love. Now your home is dying, as all things must.
Your future lies beyond Makeb.
But you won't die with it. You will survive. Gather your memories and your friends close.
Cherish the legacy of Makeb, and your world will live on. The Force is with you!
Makeb is a proud member of the Republic, and we are all Republic citizens. Whatever happens to this world, we stand united.
The Republic will save you.
The Hutts want to crush your spirits--assault your freedom. But the Republic protects its own. You will have a new home.
Stand against your oppressors, and know that Havoc Squad is with you every step of the way. For Makeb! For the Republic!
When I landed on Makeb, it was just another job for the Supreme Chancellor. Now, I know you.
I'm proud to be your hero.
I've felt your pain. I know the sting of Hutt fury, the destruction of a groundquake.
I love you!
You, too, sugar.
I love you!
Back atcha, gorgeous.
Anyway, my point is this: Makeb's got a bright future, and you're its stars!
Your planet's collapsing beneath you, and the Hutt Cartel remains in power. We've given you hope, but we're a long way from being safe.
Makeb is still doomed.
Are you trying to cause a panic?
Just a cautionary reminder, given out of love and concern. Three cheers for our heroes!
Keep the spotlight to yourself, Shalim.
I hate public speaking.
A hero who believes in deeds, not words! How about a round of applause?
I meant what I said. All of it.
The ark is safe, and we'll soon have it ready to fly. We've earned a moment to celebrate--especially you.
Back at the Hutt Embassy, we found a holo that said the ark was being built to transport something called isotope-5.
We have mysteries to solve.
When we faced Grevin, he said isotope-5 will change the galaxy--but he wouldn't say how. Does that name mean anything to you?
Sounds more like some idiotic Hutt code name than a scientific discovery.
Maybe Lemda can show me the sights? This might be our only chance to relax.
[Flirt] Join me, Lemda?
I'll relax when I'm not standing on a planet that's falling apart, but... I appreciate the offer?
Anything that gets you closer to the Republic, right? Are you hoping I'll endorse you for Supreme Chancellor?
You're a real schemer, Shalim.
I sincerely hope I haven't offended you. I'm merely expressing my gratitude.
Give it a rest, Uncle.
We finally have mighty Toborro the Hutt's attention. Calling to congratulate us, old friend?
Insolent scum! I will kill everyone on Makeb if you do not return my ark! Now!
If we give you back that ship, Toborro, we all die when Makeb's core explodes. We're keeping it. Let us know if you need a lift.
The ark is our only hope.
Thieving filth! You're condemning millions of your pathetic people to a painful death!
You don't frighten us, Toborro. If you had anything left to hit us with, you wouldn't be talking.
You're out of weapons.
I still have enough power to kill everyone on this planet--long before it tears itself apart! And my way will be more painful!
You're not much of a salesman, Toborro--but I've always wanted to see a Hutt grovel. Can you actually bend over enough to kiss the ground?
Say "pretty please."
I kneel to no one! You will drown in lakes of fire and blood!
Spare us your empty threats, Toborro. Makeb is doomed, and the ark is our only escape. If we give it back, we're all dead.
You can still evacuate through conventional means. What do you prefer--saving twenty percent of your citizens, or losing all of them?
You insects don't comprehend the ark! It requires isotope-5 to fuel its engines--and only I possess that substance!
Thanks for telling us where to fuel up the ark. We'll be right over.
Then we'll come get some.
Fool! Do you think it will be that simple?
Do you honestly expect us to believe that? You've been lying since you arrived on Makeb.
Stop lying.
Your ignorance is why the Republic will fall!
I've had all I can take of your jabbering. You want to play rough? Be right there.
Time for you to die.
Yes, by all means--race to your death!
I mastered isotope-5 long before your idiotic rebellion. And now you've given me an excuse to demonstrate my knowledge. Behold and despair!
That is only a sample of the power at my disposal. The slaughter of your people will continue until the ark is mine again!
I recognize where that droid was attacking: Tarlam. It's a small city without defenses. I'll summon a shuttle to take you there. Please, save my people!
I don't care how big Toborro's weapon is--I've never met a machine that could defeat a Jedi.
That droid will be stopped.
Toborro's new weapon must be stopped. The Jedi will protect your city.
I'll depart immediately.
Machines are made to be broken. Havoc Squad will dismantle Toborro's plaything.
I'll take down that droid.
If I've learned anything lately, it's the bigger they are, the harder they fall. Toborro's new toy is going down.
Leave that droid to me.
Never trust a desperate Hutt. Toborro's trying to intimidate us with lies and bullying.
This is a trick.
It's working. I need you to stop his madness before it goes any further.
The easiest way to solve all our problems is frying that Hutt.
Let's just kill Toborro now.
We can't focus on revenge right now--my citizens are in danger.
I'm sending an emergency signal to the Republic. We need a science expert down here.
If Toborro's telling the truth about isotope-5, we're still stranded--and that Hutt's going to slaughter us all. Hurry to Tarlam and stop his droid!
We can't defend the ark against an all-out attack by the Regulators. You have to stop them.
We can't thank you enough for securing the ark, Master Jedi. You turned certain death into a chance for survival.
Thank you for securing the ark, Major. No one on this planet fights with Havoc Squad's heart. You honor us.
You really stuck it to the Hutts this time, Captain. Without the ark, the Cartel can't profit from Makeb's destruction.
Word is spreading about the ark. The only reason my people are holding together is because you've given them hope.
The Hutts won't give up the ark without a fight--and they have an army. Our battles have just begun.
It's not over yet.
We've bought a reprieve, but now the Hutts have something to fight for--and their forces outnumber ours.
The Hutts will retaliate.
The battles we've fought till now are nothing compared to what's coming. The Regulators will be gunning for that ark.
Expect a counterattack.
Hutts are sore losers. If they can't have the ark, they may blast her just to spite us.
The ark is now a target.
You're more right than you know.
The ark's missing more than a few vital components. We're still a long way off from loading it with evacuees.
That ship needs a lot of work.
I wouldn't trust that hunk of junk as a doorstop. If you don't have your own way off this rock, you'd better find one.
Don't bother with the ark.
Foreman Tiero is one of the best ship men on Makeb. He'll get the job done--if we protect his construction site.
We intercepted priority signals from the Cartel. Every Regulator in this hemisphere has been ordered to retake the ark at all costs.
Ilosov, organize a defense force. Anyone willing to fight gets a blaster and a ride to the ark's construction site. Go now.
Prepare that place for war.
We'll need your shuttle, Navigator. Come on.
Shalim, contact your allies. We'll need all the help we can get.
Already done. Impending doom was an excellent motivator.
If we knew the Regulator army's staging point, we could potentially cut them off.
We need to take the offensive.
Surest way to close any deal is by blocking the competition from bidding.
Maybe the ark could fly somewhere safe to complete repairs?
Can we move the ark?
That was my first thought as well. Unfortunately, we're still figuring out how to activate the ark's engines.
Some refugees know how to use a blaster. I'll organize a security force to protect the ark. Navigator, we'll need your shuttle--come on.
My people are scouting for Regulator activity and reporting what they find. We've identified one major staging area.
The Fingers: originally one mesa, until a quake redecorated the place. Now it's held together by a series of interconnected energy fields--light bridges.
The Regulators store heavy artillery and weapon caches there. If those mercenaries rearm, they'll blast us to oblivion.
Without their most powerful armaments, the Regulators won't be nearly as dangerous. They might even surrender.
We'll destroy those weapons.
We'll certainly give them something to think about.
The mercenaries place too much confidence in force of arms. Destroying their caches will collapse our enemy's resolve.
We'll destroy those weapons.
I hadn't considered that, Master Jedi--but the thought makes me smile.
The ark construction site isn't built to withstand bombardment. We'd better take out the artillery first.
We'll destroy those weapons.
It'll make a fitting display of power, Major.
That sounds like a good place for me to blow up. The fireworks will let every merc on Makeb know we're coming for them.
We'll destroy those weapons.
I'm sure you'll put on quite a show, Captain.
If the splintered mesa is barely held together, one strong quake will wipe out these weapons for good.
A good quake solves that.
Too much to hope for. Seismic forecast models indicate the Fingers are safe for the short term. If I'm wrong, feel free to complain.
You're our best shot at taking out those caches and artillery before the enemy reaches them.
Weaponry's useless without someone to wield it. Shouldn't we target the Regulator army directly?
Is that our best target?
The enemy is still gathering forces, but their biggest weapons are clustered at the Fingers now. We'll never get a better shot at them.
We'll take their toys away, but I won't be happy until the Regulators have cashed their last credit vouchers. Point me at that scum.
I want to wipe out their army.
We know the Regulators' army also includes war droids and a battle platform. We're still scouting for those.
Translation, he's finding lots of ways to risk your life.
You're trying to save your people, and we're your best chance. There's nothing to apologize for.
We all do what we must.
Who was apologizing?
It's a good thing I have a reason to always come back.
[Flirt] I'll survive for you.
Flirting with disaster--literally.
Nice of you to admit you dragged the Republic into this mess so we could fight your battles for you.
You're exploiting us.
Take it out on the Regulators.
Once you've destroyed the artillery and weapon caches in the Fingers, contact me. I should have additional targets by then. Good luck.
The ark is our only hope of evacuating everyone off Makeb. We can't let the Hutts keep it to themselves.
Find this Project Failsafe. Chief Hurkwill is standing by to assist you.
This is nothing, Uncle. I've run the numbers. Two days, maybe less, and your office is at the bottom of a sinkhole.
At least your expensive education has finally amounted to something....
Told you I'd repay that loan. Bet you're wishing you'd listened to me sooner, not dismissed me as a "loud-mouthed conservationist."
Master Jedi... Lemda told me of your incredible rescue. Words cannot convey my thanks.
Major, welcome back. Lemda told me all about Havoc Squad's daring rescue. Thank you.
Captain, come in. Lemda told me of your incredible heroics. I'm impressed.
Welcome back, all of you. Lemda told me everything: the mercenaries, the quake, your amazing rescue.
We suspected Makeb was becoming unstable, but I had no idea things were this bad. We never should've let the Hutt Cartel establish their mining operation.
I didn't realize the Cartel set up shop on your world before the takeover.
How long have Hutts been here?
We negotiated mining contracts with them a decade ago. They gave our economy a tremendous boost.
I've been yelling about that boost for years. Moving on....
Lemda mentioned that there's a way to stop this disaster. What is it?
We need to save the planet.
You held back a lot of bad news, Shalim. Why didn't you tell us about the planet's instability?
You've been misleading us.
I didn't want to cause a panic. Makeb's people must stand together. Only through unity can we overcome this crisis.
Know what doesn't help right now? Speeches. Unless I'm talking.
The Regulators who held me hostage were a chatty bunch. Mostly filthy language and bragging about their blasters--but the leader said something interesting.
He mentioned "Project Failsafe": a Hutt emergency plan if their mining went wrong. That mercenary believed the Hutts have something to instantly stabilize Makeb.
The Hutts clearly don't care who gets hurt by these groundquakes. We need to find their failsafe now.
We have a goal.
The Cartel wouldn't have a failsafe if they didn't plan on pushing Makeb to the brink of destruction. We can't allow that.
We need that failsafe.
We can't count on Hutts to do the right thing. We need to seize that failsafe and put it to use immediately.
Project Failsafe will be ours.
The Hutts only care about saving their own oily hides. We'd better grab this Project Failsafe before there's another quake.
Sounds good. Let's steal it.
Glad you feel that way, because you need to steal it. Assuming we can find it.
Did this mercenary say anything else about Project Failsafe? Where it is, how it works?
What else did you learn?
The conversation dried up when you started attacking their camps. Not that I'm ungrateful.
Could anyone stabilize an entire planet's core and crust instantly? It doesn't seem feasible.
That's an unlikely remedy.
Agreed--but the Cartel has top-level scientists on their payroll. Who knows what they might have discovered?
If the Hutts can save Makeb, what are we worried about? Call and tell them to switch on their failsafe.
So the crisis is over?
Millions could die while we wait for the Hutts to act. We need to claim Project Failsafe for ourselves before it's too late.
Talaos City. The Hutt Embassy database.
Ilosov's right. Data on Project Failsafe would be stored in the Hutt Embassy's computers in Talaos City. Unfortunately, that's under Cartel control.
We need Chief Hurkwill, Talaos City's former security commander. He and a few loyal men have a hidden camp outside the city. They'll get you inside the city and embassy.
We'll head there now. Tell Chief Hurkwill to get ready.
Let's get moving.
How does a security chief know the way into the Hutt Embassy?
You're sure he can help us?
Hurkwill set up the Hutts' original defenses. He built it; he knows how to break it.
Why is he hiding outside the city? Did he get fired as security commander?
"Former" security commander?
In a manner of speaking. The Hutts put a death mark on his head.
The Hutts control Talaos City and the surrounding area. You'll have to land a shuttle in the countryside. Expect plenty of Regulators. Chief Hurkwill's camp is hidden at these coordinates.
Don't die. You're all we've got.
You can use my personal shuttle to reach the Frinn Mesa. Please, bring Lemda back alive.
You honor my home, Master Jedi. I'm Shalim Avesta. The Supreme Chancellor promised us relief, but you're more than I ever hoped.
Welcome, Major. I'm Shalim Avesta. The Supreme Chancellor pledged support, but the elite Havoc Squad? It's an honor.
Welcome, Captain. I'm Shalim Avesta. The Supreme Chancellor says you're one of the Republic's foremost experts on the Hutt Cartel.
Come in, please. I'm Shalim Avesta. The Supreme Chancellor promised to send the best. It's not every day a politician delivers on a promise.
My family helped found Makeb. Avesta Mining has led our Business Council for decades. I was practically Chief of State before the Cartel's takeover.
It wasn't an easy decision, but if joining the Republic is the only way to reclaim my homeworld's freedom, so be it.
The Empire wouldn't treat you any better than the Hutts. The Republic and the Jedi Order will protect this world.
There are much worse allies.
I only ask that Makeb's existing government retain a voice after this crisis ends.
Clinging to your past will not save this planet's future. A true leader knows how to relinquish control for the greater good.
Know when to let others help.
You have my full support, Master Jedi. I trust I'll have yours in return.
Nobody's asking you to step down from office. Once the Hutts are gone, Makeb will need a government.
You can still be in charge.
I appreciate that vote of confidence, Major. I hope your Supreme Chancellor honors it.
Personally, I would've offered the Republic a little less than your whole planet. How'd a high roller like you get suckered into this deal?
Independence has advantages.
Supreme Chancellor Saresh required a full commitment to the Republic. Given the circumstances, I couldn't refuse.
You don't sound happy about this alliance. What made your decision to accept the Republic's help so difficult?
Why wasn't it an easy choice?
Makeb's been independent since our founding. It's always been part of our people's character.
We're your only chance of defeating the Hutts. You either work with us, or take them on alone.
Obey us, or we'll leave.
Forgive me if I sounded ungrateful. Of course we're happy to join your Republic.
Ilosov is a former mercenary with the InterStellar Regulators--until recently, Makeb's trusted private army and police force.
Quit when the Regulators sold out to the Hutts. I don't betray a client for credits.
Exceptions like him notwithstanding, the Cartel bought off the Regulator forces and turned our former protectors against us.
A coup of this scale doesn't happen overnight. The Hutts must have had these mercenaries in their pockets for months.
This took long-term planning.
Some Regulators started doing side jobs for the Cartel a while back. They're all in command positions now.
How many ex-mercenaries do you have on your side? Enough to take down the rest?
Are there more like Ilosov?
Regulators who refused the Hutt buyout either ran or got shot for disloyalty before they could.
The Hutts want Makeb badly.
The Hutts wouldn't risk open war, much less pay for a mercenary army, without good cause.
Planetary conquests aren't typical of the Hutts. Whatever they're after on Makeb, it must outweigh the cost of bribing mercenaries.
Hutts tend to wallow in their riches, not waste them on pricey takeovers. Any idea what lit the fire under their tails?
I didn't stick around to hear the whole sales pitch. Wouldn't have mattered, anyway.
I still don't know why this has happened. We've conducted peaceful business with the Hutt Cartel for years.
Casualty and damage reports coming in... Talaos City got rattled pretty hard, but no injuries. Lucky.
That's the fifth groundquake since the Hutts' takeover. The last one leveled the Tigon mining colony. They're still pulling bodies from the rubble.
The Supreme Chancellor never said anything about groundquakes. Did you tell her about them?
This wasn't in the briefing.
I didn't think it was relevant. The tremors weren't notable--not until recently, anyway.
These groundquakes started after the Hutts invaded? Doesn't sound like a coincidence.
Could there be a connection?
You aren't the first to voice that thought.
Deadly atmosphere, groundquakes and covered in Hutts... real paradise you've got here!
Makeb is one lousy planet.
I'll have you know, we've built some of the finest vacation resorts outside the Core systems.
Won't matter if these groundquakes demolish them all.
My niece Lemda is a respected geophysicist. She joined our resistance to prove there's a link between the groundquakes and the Hutts' deep-core mining.
She was taking seismic readings on a deserted mesa when a whole company of Regulators swarmed in. We've lost contact with her.
I sent search parties to bring Lemda back, but they aren't trained or equipped to fight a mercenary force of that size.
I have a feeling your niece discovered something--and the Hutts sent the Regulators to stop her from getting away.
The mercs are hunting her, too.
That's my fear as well.
What kind of people are in these search parties? Are they at least armed?
Who did you send?
The bulk of our forces are civilian volunteers. A few know how to fight; most don't.
I came to drive the Cartel off Makeb, not investigate ground tremors or babysit your niece.
I'm just here to fight Hutts.
Please, this is important. The Hutts would never have sent that many Regulators after Lemda without good reason.
Getting reports from our search parties. Dozens of Regulators have pushed them back to the landing zone. We lose that, we'll never find Lemda.
If your allies can hold out until we arrive, we'll break the siege and rescue your niece. You have my word as a Jedi.
Tell your people help is near.
Once they know you're on the way, my people will fight twice as hard.
Tell your people they'll soon fight alongside Jedi. I know a thing or two about solving mysteries the hard way.
Let me handle this.
Let's hope the Regulators are smart enough to recognize when they're outmatched.
We'll show those traitor mercenaries what real soldiers look like.
Havoc Squad can hold the line.
Don't underestimate them. A lot of Regulators are ex-military.
The situation's grim, the odds are against us, and the bad guys have the numbers. Good thing you've got me.
I didn't come here to lose.
Either Chancellor Saresh has a cruel sense of humor, or you're not just a "Hutt expert." I hope you make good on that boast.
You know the Regulators better than anyone. We could use your help out there.
Can you help us fight, Ilosov?
I prefer that Ilosov stay here. The Regulators don't know about our rebellion yet, but if they find out, I'll need his expertise to survive.
This could all be a waste of time. If the Regulators found her, she's already dead.
Don't assume she's alive.
Even if that's true, her research findings may have survived. If I have to lose my niece, I'd rather it not be in vain.
Take my personal shuttle to Frinn Mesa. Lane Ferow is our man at the landing zone.
Welcome to Makeb. Please excuse me--I'm in the middle of planning a rebellion.
